Not NTR. This is "BSS". The only reason this is in the NTR tag is because "BSS" tag is still underground.



 BSS stands for ぼくがさきにすきだったのに / Boku ga Saki ni Suki datta no ni loosely translates to "Even though I loved her first" which is a subgenre of NTR where the main guy and girl aren't officially in relationships such as girlfriend or wife, but the story still evokes feelings of jealously and loss when the main girl ends up with someone else"

Just for people who are asking, "Is this NTR".  This technically counts as NTR in Japan because it is what is "perceived" by the MC.  The word NTR means "to be taken away" which in this case, he perceives that this childhood friend is being taken away.

So although they weren't technically dating, in technical Japanese terms, it still counts as ntr.
